<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Variables

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Checks whether the tested item is null.<br>
Which null type the item has to be equal to depends on the type of game entity tested:

{<template><title>!</title></template> class<template><title>=</title></template>"wikitable" style<template><title>=</title></template>"text-align: center"

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> important </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> A test via <template><title>=</title></template><template><title>=</title></template> does '''not''' work, because a null value is not equal to anything, not even itself ([[configNull]] being the exception).
See also [[isEqualTo]].</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>pr</name>=<value> [[teamMemberNull]] for [[Team Member]] type is '''not''' supported. Use <template><title>ic</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[[private]] _isNull <template><title>=</title></template> _teamMember [[isEqualTo]] [[teamMemberNull]]</value></part></template> instead.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[isNull]] entity

</value></part><part><name>p1 </name>=<value> entity: [[Object]], [[Control]], [[Display]], [[Group]], [[Location]], [[Task]], [[Script]], [[Config]] or [[Diary Record]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]]

</value></part><part><name>x1 </name>=<value> <code>[[if]] ([[isNull]] obj) [[then]] {[[hint]] "doesn't exist";};</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[controlNull]], [[displayNull]], [[grpNull]], [[locationNull]], [[objNull]], [[taskNull]], [[teamMemberNull]], [[scriptNull]], [[configNull]], [[typeName]]
</value></part></template>
